name: V3 Data type CD (ConceptDescriptor)
description: A concept descriptor represents any kind of concept usually by giving a code defined in a code system. A concept descriptor can contain the original text or phrase that served as the basis of the coding and one or more translations into different coding systems. A concept descriptor can also contain qualifiers to describe, e.g., the concept of a "left foot" as a postcoordinated term built from the primary code "FOOT" and the qualifier "LEFT". In cases of an exceptional value, the concept descriptor need not contain a code but only the original text describing that concept.

element.label: Exceptional Value Detail
element.definition: If a value is an exceptional value (NULL-value), this specifies in what way and why proper information is missing.

element.label: Code
element.definition: The plain code symbol defined by the code system. For example, "784.0" is the code symbol of the ICD-9 code "784.0" for headache.

element.label: Code System
element.definition: Specifies the code system that defines the code.

element.label: Code System Name
element.definition: The common name of the coding system.

element.label: Code System Version
element.definition: If applicable, a version descriptor defined specifically for the given code system.

element.label: Display Name
element.definition: A name or title for the code, under which the sending system shows the code value to its users.

element.label: Original Text
element.definition: The text or phrase used as the basis for the coding.

element.label: Translation
element.definition: A set of other concept descriptors that translate this concept descriptor into other code systems.

element.label: Qualifier
element.definition: Specifies additional codes that increase the specificity of the the primary code.
The valueSetVersion extension adds an attribute for elements with a CD dataType which indicates the version of the particular value set constraining the coded concept.
